Championship|2009]]|}} }} '''Mesut Özil''' ({{IPA-de|ˈmeːzut ˈøːzil}}, {{IPA-tr|meˈsut ˈœzil|lang}}; born 15 October 1988) is a German professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]. He is considered to be one of the best players in the world.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/11/02/ranking-the-20-best-players-in-the-premier-league-october-2016/mesut-ozil/ | title=Ranking the best players in the Premier League | work=The Daily Telegraph | date=2 November 2016 | accessdate=11 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/10/13/mesut-ozil-still-one-best-players-world-says-arsene-wenger/ | title=Özil still 'one of the world's best' says Wenger | work=The Daily Telegraph | date=13 October 2017 | accessdate=11 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/ozil-is-one-of-the-best-players-in-the-world-under-fire/1l89o8e6gg6dn1bfaik226ji20 | title=Özil still 'one of the world's best' says Reus | publisher=Goal | date=25 June 2018 | accessdate=11 August 2018}}</ref>
Özil plays mostly as an attacking midfielder, but can also be deployed as a winger. He began his senior career as a member of his hometown club [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]] in the [[Bundesliga]], departing two seasons later to join [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] for €5 million. He garnered break-out attention at the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]], where at age 22, Özil was instrumental in the side's campaign where they reached the semi-finals, losing to eventual champions [[Spain national football team|Spain]]. He was also nominated for the [[Golden Ball (FIFA)|Golden Ball Award]], as well as being ranked first in assists in major European and domestic competitions, with 25.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.imscouting.com/global-news-article/The-top-10-assists-leaders-in-Europe-for-201011/13447/ | title=The top 10 assists leaders in Europe for 2010⁄11 | publisher=imscouting.com | date=30 May 2011 | accessdate=13 May 2012}}</ref> This garnered him a €15 million transfer to [[La Liga]] club [[Real Madrid]].
At Madrid, Özil won the [[Copa del Rey]] in his first season, before registering a league high 17 assists as the Spanish side won the league title in the [[2011–12 La Liga|following season]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/stats/assists/_/league/ESP.1/year/2010/spanish-primera-division?cc=5901 | title=Spanish La Liga | publisher=EXPN Soccernat | accessdate=13 May 2012}}</ref> He also won the [[Supercopa de España]] in the same season, becoming renowned for his technical skills and creativity; due to his agility, finesse and versatility as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]], he has also been compared to [[Zinedine Zidane]] by former manager [[José Mourinho]].<ref name=ESPN>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnstar.com/football/primera-liga/news/detail/item807157/Mourinho:-Ozil-will-make-history-at-Real/|title=Mourinho: Ozil will make history at Real|publisher=ESPNSTAR.com|date=26 May 2012|accessdate=26 May 2012}}</ref>
Following a second-place La Liga finish to rivals [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in the [[2012-13 La Liga|2012–13]] season, Özil relocated to England to join [[Premier League]] side [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in a then club-record deal worth £42.5 million (€50 million),<ref name="Arsenal-sign-1">{{cite news|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/german-international-ozil-joins-arsenal|title=German international Özil joins Arsenal|date=2 September 2013|accessdate=2 September 2013|publisher=Arsenal F.C.}}</ref> making him the [[List of most expensive association football transfers|most expensive German player of all time]].<ref name="Arsenal-sign-2">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23929339 |title=Mesut Özil: Arsenal sign Real Madrid midfielder for £42.4m |publisher=BBC |date=2 September 2013 | accessdate = 4 September 2013 | first = David | last = Ornstein}}</ref><ref name="Arsenal-sign-3">{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/234697.html |title= Arsenal smash club record to sign Mesut Özil |date=2 September 2013 |work=The Guardian | accessdate = 4 September 2013}}</ref> During his first season, Özil helped end the club's largely publicised [[History of Arsenal F.C. (1966–present)|nine-year trophy drought]], winning the [[2014 FA Cup Final|FA Cup]] in 2014. He later became victorious in two more FA Cup campaigns, while also winning the [[FA Community Shield]]. Özil would also record the second most assists (19) in a Premier League season in [[2014–15 Premier League|2014–15]], as well as being named in multiple teams of the season in England.
At international level, Özil played 92 matches for the Germany national team, scoring 23 goals, and registered 40 assists. He has also won a record five German Player of the Year awards. Özil represented his country in three [[FIFA World Cup]]s, as well as two [[UEFA European Championship]]s, and was an integral part in both the 2010 FIFA World Cup and [[UEFA Euro 2012]] team in South Africa and Ukraine, starring as the joint-highest assist provider in both competitions. Özil was also a key contributor as Germany won the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] in Brazil, gaining several plaudits for his versatility and creativity. After the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], Özil [[Mesut Özil#Retirement controversy|retired from international competition]], alleging discrimination and disrespect by the [[German Football Association]] (DFB) and the German media.
==Club career== ===Schalke 04=== After plying his trade at youth level for various clubs in [[Gelsenkirchen]], including a five-year stint for [[Rot-Weiss Essen]], Özil moved to the youth system of [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]] in 2005. He was deployed a midfielder and wore 17 as his squad number, after starting as a playmaker and central attacking midfielder in the place of the suspended [[Lincoln (footballer)|Lincoln]] in [[Ligapokal]] matches against [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]] and [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kicker.de/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/artikel/352932|title=Ein 17-Jähriger soll Lincoln ersetzen|publisher=kicker.de|language=German|accessdate=13 November 2007|date=27 July 2006|author=Jean-Julien Beer}}</ref> Upon making the first team at Schalke, he was described as "the next big thing". However, soon after declining an offer from Schalke 04, claiming that a yearly salary of €1.5 million would not be enough, he eventually fell out with club management and moved on to [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] in January 2008.<ref name="Mesut Özil Bio">{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/player/_/id/84775/mesut-ozil?cc=5901|title=Mesut Özil Bio|publisher=espnsoccernet.com|accessdate=9 November 2010}}</ref> This led to [[Mirko Slomka]], the then-Schalke 04 manager, claiming that Özil would not play another match for Schalke 04.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/sport/fussball/kurzpaesse-ewerthon-nach-barcelona-kuffour-nach-amsterdam-a-531698.html | title=Kurzpässe: Ewerthon nach Barcelona, Kuffour nach Amsterdam | work=Der Spiegel | date=29 January 2008}}</ref>
===Werder Bremen=== [[File:Mesut Özil Werder Bremen.jpg|thumb|upright|Özil with [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] in April 2010]] On 31 January 2008, Özil moved to [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] for a reported fee of {{€|5 million}}, signing a contract with the German club until 30 June 2011. Other than Werder Bremen, [[Hannover 96]] and [[VfB Stuttgart]] were reportedly interested as well in binding Özil to their respective clubs, however did not want to pay such a high transfer fee.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.spiegel.de/sport/fussball/millionen-deal-bremen-verpflichtet-schalker-oezil-a-532301.html | title= Millionen-Deal: Bremen verpflichtet Schalker Özil | work= Der Spiegel | date=31 January 2008}}</ref> After transferring to Werder Bremen, Özil got the jersey number 11. On 26 April 2008 (30th match day) Özil scored the go-ahead goal in the 33rd minute against [[Karlsruher SC]], to put his team up 2–1. This was Özil's very first Bundesliga goal. He played in twelve games throughout the second half of the season, six times playing in the starting formation, becoming second with Werder Bremen in the Bundesliga at the end of the 2007–08 season.
Although Bremen failed to get going in their 2008–09 Bundesliga season, eventually finishing a disappointing tenth, Özil managed to make a significant impact in most games and came away with a respectable three goals and 15 assists that highlighted his attacking credentials.<ref name="Shapland, Dave"/> He helped lead the North German club to the [[2009 DFB-Pokal Final|2009 DFB-Pokal]] with the winning goal in a 1–0 victory over [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]] in Berlin.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.4to40.com/wordpress/biographies-for-kids/mesut-oezil/|title=Mesut Oezil|publisher=4to40.com|accessdate=29 October 2015}}</ref> He also excelled in Europe where he led Werder Bremen to the final of the last ever [[UEFA Cup]], losing out to [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]] of Ukraine.<ref name="Shapland, Dave">{{cite web|url=http://www.adifferentleague.co.uk/p6_47_787_bundesliga-player-profile-mesut-ozil-werder-bremen.html|title=Bundesliga player profile – Mesut Ozil, Werder Bremen|last=Shapland|first=Dave|publisher=adifferentleague.co.uk|date=28 November 2009|accessdate=9 November 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101119215410/http://www.adifferentleague.co.uk/p6_47_787_bundesliga-player-profile-mesut-ozil-werder-bremen.html|archivedate=19 November 2010}}</ref>
In the 2009–10 season, Özil became the key playmaker of Werder Bremen, stepping into the shoes of Brazilian [[Diego (footballer, born 1985)|Diego]] who had left for [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]], was named the best player of the first leg of the 2009 Bundesliga season.<ref name="Real profile English">{{cite web|url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1193041476158/1330012508587/jugador/Jugador/Ozil.htm|title=Mesut Özil|publisher=Real Madrid C.F|accessdate=27 April 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120428162816/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1193041476158/1330012508587/jugador/Jugador/Ozil.htm|archivedate=28 April 2012}}</ref> On 1 May 2010, the 33rd match day, Özil played his 100th Bundesliga game, scoring the 1–0 lead in a 2–0 win against his former club Schalke 04. Özil went on and led Werder Bremen to become third in the league and again to the DFB-Pokal final, however this time it was lost against Bayern Munich by 0–4. In his [[2009–10 Bundesliga|second season]], Bremen finished a respectable third, with Özil contributing 9 goals and 17 assists in 31 league fixture appearances. During the 2009–10 season, Özil was also declared as the "best player of the first half of the season".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sportschau.de/sp/kurzmeldungen.jsp?meldung=7&popup | title=Sportschau.de: Wahl – Mesut Özil ist Spieler der Hinrunde | publisher=Sportschau | language = German |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090928021958/http://www.sportschau.de/sp/kurzmeldungen.jsp?meldung=7&popup |archivedate=28 September 2009}}</ref>
===Real Madrid=== ====2010–11 season==== [[File:Mesut ozil v drese realu madrid.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Özil playing for [[Real Madrid CF|Real Madrid]] in 2010]] Due to his performances in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]], Özil ensured his place among Europe's top young talents. He was sought by teams like [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]], [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]]. English striker [[Wayne Rooney]] was one of the many admirers Özil had garnered with his performances in the World Cup, and had even asked [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] manager [[Alex Ferguson|Sir Alex Ferguson]] to sign the German playmaker.<ref>{{cite news | url = https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/oct/22/ferguson-wayne-rooney-sign-mesut-ozil-book | title = Sir Alex Ferguson: 'Wayne Rooney wanted me to sign Mesut Özil' | work = The Guardian | date = 22 October 2013 | accessdate = 29 March 2014 | first = Owen | last = Gibson}}</ref> There were reports claiming that a deal was struck for a transfer to Barcelona, but Werder Bremen denied the reports and on 17 August 2010, the team announced that they had reached an agreement with Real Madrid for Özil's transfer.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330010084519/noticia/Noticia/Mesut_Ozil_to_play_for_Real_Madrid.htm|title=Mesut Özil to Play for Real Madrid|accessdate=17 August 2010|publisher=Real Madrid C.F.|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100819014107/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330010084519/noticia/Noticia/Mesut_Ozil_to_play_for_Real_Madrid.htm|archivedate=19 August 2010}}</ref> The transfer fee is believed to have been in the region of €15 million.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/8921836.stm|title=Real Madrid confirm signing of Germany star Mesut Ozil|publisher=BBC sport|date=17 August 2010|accessdate=17 August 2010}}</ref> Upon signing, Özil said, "When the offer came in to join Real Madrid, there is no decision to make. Let's be honest – you don't refuse this club. I was in no rush to leave Werder Bremen, but this is one club you say yes to. They are an institution, a club with a fantastic history, stadium and squad full of world-class players. The prospect of performing at the Bernabéu is so awesome you jump straight in."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/columns/story?id=821820&sec=uefachampionsleague&root=uefachampionsleague&cc=5901|title=Mesut Ozil Interview: Real Madrid's new star|date=10 September 2010|accessdate=22 April 2012|publisher=ESPN FC}}</ref> Özil made his debut on 22 August in a friendly match against [[Hércules CF|Hércules]], which Real Madrid won 3–1.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/12/spain/2010/08/22/2082959/hercules-1-3-real-madrid-benzema-brace-seals-friendly|title=Hercules 1–3 Real Madrid: Benzema Brace Seals Friendly Triumph|publisher=Goal.com|date=22 August 2010| accessdate=23 August 2010|last=Madden|first=Paul}}</ref> His jersey numbers were changed often before the season started. He was given the number 26 in the pre-season and 19 for his debut. But following the transfer of [[Rafael van der Vaart]] to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], he was given the vacant 23.
Özil was brought in to back up teammate [[Kaká]], but due to his surgery, Özil obtained a starting role. He then made his La Liga debut for Real Madrid as a substitute for [[Ángel Di María]] in the 62nd minute against [[RCD Mallorca|Mallorca]], which Real Madrid drew 0–0.<ref name="Real Madrid">{{cite web|url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330012984541/noticia/Cronica/1330012984541.htm |title=Report: The Whites make their debut in the 2010/11 edition of La Liga |accessdate=16 September 2010 |publisher=Real Madrid C.F. |date=29 August 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100902025048/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330012984541/noticia/Cronica/1330012984541.htm |archivedate=2 September 2010 |df= }}</ref> [[File:Mesut Özil and Daniele Bonera.jpg|thumb|right|Özil taking on [[Daniele Bonera]] of [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] during the [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League]]]] He made his season debut in the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] on 15 September. He got his first assist with Real Madrid in the 74th minute against [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] after he crossed for a [[Gonzalo Higuaín]] goal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330015494251/noticia/Cronica/The_Whites_earn_a_victory_in_their_Champions_League_debut.htm|title=Report: The Whites earn a victory in their Champions League debut|accessdate=16 September 2010|publisher=Real Madrid C.F.|date=15 September 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100918221222/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330015494251/noticia/Cronica/The_Whites_earn_a_victory_in_their_Champions_League_debut.htm|archivedate=18 September 2010}}</ref>
He walked off the pitch as a second-half substitute to standing ovations in his first two games as a starter at the [[Santiago Bernabéu Stadium]]. His first goal came in a league match against [[Deportivo de La Coruña]] on 3 October 2010, in a 6–1 victory.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/47748/real-madrid-vs-deportivo/report|title=Real Madrid 6–1 Deportivo La Coruna: Ronaldo Brace Sees Los Blancos Go Above Barcelona|publisher=goal.com|date=3 October 2010|accessdate=20 October 2010|first=Subhankar|last=Mondal}}</ref> Özil's first Champions League goal with Real came in the 14th minute against [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] on 19 October 2010.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/oct/19/real-madrid-milan-live|title=Real Madrid v Milan – as it happened|work=The Guardian|date=19 October 2010|accessdate=20 October 2010|first=Tom|last=Lutz}}</ref> On 22 December, he made his debut in the [[Copa del Rey]], scoring once in an 8–0 victory over [[UD Levante|Levante]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/54213/real-madrid-vs-levante/report|title=Real Madrid vs Levante Report | publisher=Goal.com|date=23 December 2010|accessdate=23 December 2010}}</ref>
He finished [[2010–11 Real Madrid C.F. season|the season]] with 25 assists, the highest for any player in any major European competition that season. Özil's performances for Real Madrid during his first season were praised by media, fans and players.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330015068338/noticia/Noticia/Praise_for_Mesut_Ozil.htm |title=Praise for Mesut Ozil |date=13 September 2010 |accessdate=4 October 2010 |publisher=Real Madrid C.F. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101006104442/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330015068338/noticia/Noticia/Praise_for_Mesut_Ozil.htm |archivedate=6 October 2010 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330046715358/noticia/Noticia/Ozil_s_magic_amazes_the_entire_planet.htm|title=Ozil's magic amazes the entire planet|publisher=Real Madrid C.F.|date=7 March 2011|accessdate=7 March 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110310153157/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330046715358/noticia/Noticia/Ozil_s_magic_amazes_the_entire_planet.htm|archivedate=10 March 2011}}</ref>
====2011–12 season==== Özil began wearing the number 10 shirt for Real Madrid in [[2011–12 La Liga|2011–12]], signalling manager [[José Mourinho]]'s intent to use the German international as his main playmaker.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-india/news/2175/la-liga/2011/07/23/2587139/mesut-ozil-to-wear-no10-shirt-for-real-madrid-in-2011-12|title=Mesut Ozil To Wear No.10 Shirt For Real Madrid in 2011–12|publisher=Goal.com| date=23 July 2011|accessdate=31 July 2011}}</ref> On 14 August 2011, Özil scored his first goal against Barcelona in ''[[El Clásico]]'' in the first leg of the [[2011 Supercopa de España]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/65089/real-madrid-vs-barcelona/report|title=Real Madrid 2–2 Barcelona: All-square in thrilling Supercopa contest | date=14 August 2011|work=''Goal.com''|accessdate=28 November 2011}}</ref> On 17 August 2011, he was [[sent off]] in the last minute of the second leg of the 2011 Supercopa after an altercation with Barça forward [[David Villa]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/65090/barcelona-vs-real-madrid/report|title=Barcelona 3–2 Real Madrid (Agg. 5–4): Lionel Messi brace wins Supercopa amid violent scenes at Camp Nou|date=17 August 2011|work=''Goal.com''|accessdate=28 August 2011}}</ref> Özil expressed his desire to end his football days at the club in an interview with German magazine ''kicker'', saying, "I'd like to end my career at Real Madrid. I know it will be difficult because I have many more years ahead of me and many younger and good players will also be out there, but I want to be part of that future. I know what I'm capable of, and I'm convinced, I'll stay at Real Madrid many years."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330080343016/noticia/Noticia/Ozil:__I_d_like_to_end_my_career_at_Real_Madrid_.htm|title=Ozil: "I'd like to end my career at Real Madrid"|publisher=Real Madrid C.F.|date=2 February 2012|accessdate=2 February 2012}}</ref>
Özil was on the short-list of the [[FIFA Ballon d'Or]] award.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/ballondor/media/newsid=1535258/index.html |title=Men's shortlists for FIFA Ballon d'Or Gala 2011 revealed |date=1 November 2011 |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=1 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111221040029/http://www.fifa.com/ballondor/media/newsid%3D1535258/index.html |archivedate=21 December 2011 |df= }}</ref> [[File:Mesut Oezil Boots Santiago Bernabeu.jpg|thumb|Özil's boots on display at the Santiago Bernabéu museum]]
He finished atop the [[2011–12 La Liga|La Liga]] assists chart, with 17 assists. On 2 May 2012, he helped Real Madrid to clinch a record 32nd [[La Liga]] title as he assisted Real's first goal and scored the second goal against Bilbao, which Real Madrid later won by 3–0. Eleven days later, Özil scored two goals in the final game of the regular season against Mallorca, once again consolidating his excellent performance with the club. The win made Real the first club in the Spanish top flight to ever reach 100 points in a single season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/323691?cc=5901|title=Ton-up Real set new landmark|publisher=ESPN Soccernet|date=13 May 2012|accessdate=13 May 2012}}</ref> His fine form with Real Madrid and German national team saw him earn nomination for [[UEFA Best Player in Europe Award]], in which he finished tenth, being the youngest player to feature in the Top 10.<ref>{{cite web|title=Iniesta, Messi, Ronaldo up for Best Player Award|url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/news/newsid=1842518.html|publisher=UEFA|accessdate=8 June 2017|date=14 August 2012}}</ref>
====2012–13 season==== With arrival of [[Luka Modrić]] before the start of the season, some in the media claimed Özil was unhappy at Real Madrid, but he later rejected such talk and claimed he was happy at the club and looking forward to competing for his place.<ref>{{cite news |title= Mesut Ozil reiterates happiness |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/1186783/mesut-ozil-happy-with-competition-at-real-madrid |publisher= ESPN | date = 11 October 2012 | accessdate = 12 October 2012}}</ref> After the start of the season, he added the [[Supercopa de España]] title to his honours. In league play, he provided an important assist to [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] who equalised in a 2–2 draw against Barcelona at Camp Nou.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/348447/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739 | title = Ronaldo, Messi share spoils in draw | publisher = ESPN FC | date = 7 October 2012 | accessdate = 16 October 2012}}</ref> On 6 November, Özil scored a crucial 89th-minute free-kick to rescue a draw for Real Madrid and secure a point against [[Borussia Dortmund]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Mesut Ozil saves Real Madrid with late goal against Borussia Dortmund |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/nov/06/real-madrid-borussia-dortmund-champions-league |newspaper= The Guardian |location=London |date= 6 November 2012 |accessdate= 9 November 2012 |first = Sid | last = Lowe}}</ref> He continued his fine form in the league as he scored another brace against Real Valladolid to rescue Real Madrid in a 3–2 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ozil to the rescue after Real hit by brace from former Man United flop Manucho |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2245233/Mesut-Ozil-rescue-Real-Madrid-hit-brace-Man-United-flop-Manucho.html |date=8 December 2012 |accessdate=14 December 2012 |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London}}</ref> He then went on to finish the season with 29 assists, although Real Madrid did not win any silverware except for the Supercopa de España, Özil's performance was praised. At the end of the season, Özil had 26 assists, more than any other player in the leagues.
===Arsenal=== [[File:Mesut Özil Arsenal (4).jpg|thumbnail|Özil taking a free kick for [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] on 22 September 2013]] On 2 September 2013, Özil agreed to join English side [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref name="Arsenal-sign-1" /> Both the fee paid for Özil as well as the contract duration were undisclosed, but they are believed to be around £42.5 million (€50 million) for a five-year deal.<ref name="Arsenal-sign-2" /> The transfer makes him the [[List of most expensive association football transfers|most expensive German football player of all time]].<ref name="Arsenal-sign-3" /> Özil was assigned the number 11 shirt and the centre-attacking midfield role by the team.<ref name="Arsenal-sign-4">{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2409704/Mesut-Ozil-signs-Arsenal-did-Real-Madrid-bully-Germany-star-42-5million-tramsfer.html|title=Did Real Madrid 'bully' Ozil into joining Arsenal? Claims in Germany suggest £42.5m record signing was forced into move|date=3 September 2013|accessdate=3 September 2013|work=Daily Mail | first = Laurie | last = Whitwell }}</ref> Contract leaks in January 2016, however, have revealed that the record fee was actually broken down to £37.4 million (€44 million) with a further £5.1 million (€6 million) split evenly over six years from July 2014, subject to Champions League qualification. A buy-back option also allows Real Madrid a 48-hour first option on Özil should Arsenal agree a sale for the playmaker to another Spanish club.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/arsenal/12119391/Mesut-Ozil-leaked-contract-reveals-Real-Madrid-have-buy-back-option-from-Arsenal.html|title=Mesut Ozil leaked contract reveals Real Madrid have buy-back option from Arsenal |author=Jeremy Wilson |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=25 January 2016 |accessdate=26 January 2016 }}</ref>
Özil said of the transfer, "At the weekend, I was certain I would stay at Real Madrid but afterwards I realised I did not have the faith from the coach or the bosses. I am a player who needs this faith and that is what I have felt from Arsenal, which is why I have joined."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/with-arsene-wengers-belief-i-can-get-even-better--mesut-ozil-8796397.html |title='With Arsene Wenger's belief I can get even better' – Mesut Ozil |date=3 September 2013 |accessdate=3 September 2013 |newspaper=London Evening Standard | first = James | last = Olley}}</ref> In Özil's first press conference, he said: "I would have come here for free, that wouldn't have been a problem." Özil additionally stated that [[Arsène Wenger]] played an important role in his decision: "When I spoke to Arsène Wenger on the phone, he was full of respect, and as a player, I need that."<ref name="Arsenal profile">{{cite web | url = http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/mesut-ozil | title = Mesut Ozil | publisher = Arsenal F.C. | accessdate = 9 March 2014}}</ref> Several Real Madrid players were dissatisfied with Özil leaving the club, including Cristiano Ronaldo, who said, "He was the player who best knew my moves in front of goal ... I'm angry about Özil leaving."<ref name="Ozil Daily Mail">{{cite news | first =Laurie | last = Whitwell |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2410973/Cristiano-Ronaldo-angry-Mesut-Ozil-transfer-Real-Madrid-Arsenal.html?ico=sport%5Eheadlines |title=Cristiano Ronaldo angry at Mesut Ozil transfer from Real Madrid to Arsenal |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=4 September 2013 |accessdate=4 September 2013}}</ref>
====2013–14 season==== [[File:Mesut Özil (9881761465) Cropped.jpg|thumb|right|upright=.8|Özil playing for Arsenal in 2013]] Özil made his debut for Arsenal in their league game away to [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] on 14 September 2013. He assisted [[Olivier Giroud]]'s goal in the 11th minute of the match as they went on to win 3–1.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23999428 |title=Sunderland 1–3 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 September 2013 |accessdate=14 September 2013}}</ref> Three days after that, he made his [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] debut for Arsenal against [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24044269 |title=Marseille 1–2 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 September 2013 |accessdate=27 September 2013 |last=Magowan |first=Alistair}}</ref> Just over three weeks after making his debut for Arsenal, he made his [[Emirates Stadium|home]] debut against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] in a 3–1 victory. He was involved in all three goals, with two assists and a free kick which was saved but fell into [[Aaron Ramsey]]'s path.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24098512 |title=Arsenal 3–1 Stoke City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 September 2013 |accessdate=27 September 2013 |last=Magowan |first=Alistair}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Arsenal, a brilliantly controlled finish from a Ramsey cross, in a 2–0 win against [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]] in the Champions League.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1314/post/first-team/arsenal-v-napoli-story-so-far |title=Arsenal 2–0 Napoli – Match Report |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=1 October 2013 |accessdate=2 October 2013}}</ref> On 19 October, he scored his first two [[2013–14 Premier League|Premier League]] goals during the 4–1 home win against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/oct/19/arsenal-norwich-city-premier-league|title=Arsenal and Mesut Özil turn on style to sweep past Norwich City |date=20 October 2013 |work=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> Özil played in all six of Arsenal's games in November. The German playmaker provided the cross for [[Jack Wilshere]]'s second goal against Marseille and gave further assists for Aaron Ramsey and [[Mathieu Flamini]] in the 3–0 win over [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]]. Özil missed the chance to score his fourth Arsenal goal when he saw his penalty in the win over Marseille saved by [[Steve Mandanda]].<ref name="Arsenal profile" />
In October, Özil was again short-listed for the FIFA Ballon d'Or award, along with former teammate Cristiano Ronaldo.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.fifa.com/ballondor/news/newsid=2207371/ | title = Men's shortlists for FIFA Ballon d'Or 2013 revealed | publisher = FIFA | date = 29 October 2013 | accessdate = 29 March 2014}}</ref> Özil was also featured on the [[UEFA Team of the Year]]. Özil began December with two goals in as many games against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] and [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]. A minor shoulder injury forced him out of the final game of December in a win against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]]. After the 6–3 defeat at [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in which he made another assist, Özil was involved in an altercation with teammate [[Per Mertesacker]], who was angry with Özil's failure to thank the travelling supporters, an omission for which he subsequently apologised via Facebook.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/266435.html |title=Ozil apologises to Arsenal fans |publisher=ESPN |date=14 December 2013 |accessdate=1 September 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Bevan |first=Chris |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25383956 |title=Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger plays down importance of Man City loss |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 December 2013 |accessdate=5 February 2014}}</ref> [[File:Olivier Giroud x Mesut Özil v Southampton - 23 Nov 2013 (cropped).jpg|thumb|left|Özil and [[Olivier Giroud]] before kick-off against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 23 November 2013]]
Özil started four of Arsenal's six games in January. The playmaker missed Arsenal's victory over Cardiff City on New Year's Day with a shoulder injury before returning to make a late appearance from the bench against Tottenham Hotspur in the [[2013–14 FA Cup|FA Cup]]. The 25-year-old produced a slide-rule pass for [[Lukas Podolski]] to score his first goal against [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] and provided the ball for [[Santi Cazorla]]'s goal against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] at the end of the month to take his assist tally to 10.<ref name="Arsenal profile" />
February was a difficult month for Özil, as he struggled to reach the heights he showed in his first few months at the club. The German playmaker pulled off a brilliant piece of skill to win a penalty against Bayern Munich in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|Champions League knockout phase]], but his spot-kick was saved by [[Manuel Neuer]]. Speaking before the draw with Manchester United, Arsène Wenger spoke about Özil, saying, "He has done well, he is adapting as well to the Premier League – we have seen it before [that it takes time]. I wouldn't like to put too much pressure on him because he has been a top-class player until now. He didn't have the best of games [at [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]] (a 5–1 loss, where Özil was the centre of attention due to a bad performance) but that can happen. He works very hard to adapt to the physical level of the Premier League and for me he is an exceptional player."<ref name="Arsenal profile" />
On 8 March, Özil scored his first goal of 2014 in a 4–1 FA Cup quarter-final win over Everton.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/mar/08/arsenal-everton-fa-cup-live-mbm|title=Arsenal v Everton: FA Cup – as it happened|date=8 March 2014|work=The Guardian}}</ref> Özil was showing signs of old form and started in Arsenal's second leg Champions League last 16 clash with Bayern Munich.<ref>{{cite web |last=Cryer |first=Andy |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26505997 |title=Bayern Munich 1–1 Arsenal (agg 3–1) |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 March 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2014}}</ref> He was substituted at half-time, and the reasoning behind it was that Özil had suffered a hamstring injury and will face a month out, missing key fixtures against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and Manchester City.<ref>{{cite web|last=Ornstein |first=David |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26544491 |title=Mesut Ozil: Arsenal's record buy out for month with hamstring injury |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 March 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2014}}</ref>
On 20 April, Özil made an instant impact with a lively display against Hull when he returned to the Arsenal team in a 3–0 win.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/mesut-ozil|title=Özil returns at Hull|date=20 April 2014|accessdate=20 April 2014|publisher=Arsenal F.C.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/apr/20/hull-city-arsenal-premier-league-match-report|title=Lukas Podolski double eases Arsenal past Hull in FA Cup final rehearsal|date=20 April 2014|accessdate=20 April 2014|work=The Guardian}}</ref> He then returned to goalscoring form with Arsenal's second in their 3–0 win over Newcastle United, and then assisted Olivier Giroud's header.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2615255/Arsenal-3-0-Newcastle-Gunners-strengthen-hold-fourth-place-brushing-aside-woeful-Toon-Emirates.html | title = Arsenal 3–0 Newcastle: Gunners strengthen hold on fourth place after brushing aside woeful Toon at the Emirates | work = Daily Mail | first = Matt | last = Barlow | date = 28 April 2014 | accessdate = 28 April 2014}}</ref> Manager Wenger praised Özil's impact upon his return, saying, "Mesut Özil is very important for the team. He's been missed while he's been injured. We've missed some very important players in an important period of the season. We're really pleased to have people like him back in the team and performing at the top level because that's what we need."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/mesut-ozil|title=Wenger praises Özil's impact in Arsenal turnaround|date=28 April 2014|accessdate=29 April 2014|publisher=Arsenal F.C.}}</ref>
Özil played all three of Arsenal's remaining fixtures during the last month of his debut season in England. The German playmaker came off at half-time in extra-time of Arsenal's [[2014 FA Cup Final]] victory over Hull at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27354148| title=Arsenal 3–2 Hull|publisher=BBC Sport| accessdate = 18 May 2014 | date = 17 May 2014 | first = Phil | last = McNulty}}</ref> Speaking before the FA Cup final, Per Mertesacker praised his compatriot's impact on the side during his first season in England. "You could see from the start that he is one of the best players in Europe," said Mertesacker. "His contributions and assists are vital for any club so we are happy to have him back."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/mesut-ozil| title=Praise from Mertesacker after Özil completes maiden Arsenal season|publisher=Arsenal F.C.| accessdate = 31 May 2014 | date = 30 May 2014 | first = Per | last = Mertesacker}}</ref> Özil completed his maiden season at Arsenal with 13 assists and seven goals in all competitions spanning a course of 40 games.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.com/player/84775/mesut-ozil?season=2013|title=Mesut Özil complete stats for 2013/14 season|date=28 April 2014|accessdate=29 April 2014|work=''espnfc.com''}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== [[File:Mesut Özil on the ball 4 (16234232390).jpg|thumbnail|Özil in a league match against Aston Villa in February 2015]] Özil returned to club training in the middle of August after participating in [[Germany national football team|Germany]]'s [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] win in Brazil. On 23 August, Özil made his first appearance of [[2014–15 Arsenal F.C. season|the season]] in a 2–2 draw with [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Goodison Park]]. On 27 August, he played a part in [[Alexis Sánchez]]'s winning goal in the second leg of the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round|qualification play-off]] against [[Beşiktaş J.K.|Beşiktaş]], playing a one-two with [[Jack Wilshere]] in the build-up to the goal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/mesut-ozil| title=Özil begins second season in England|publisher=Arsenal F.C.| accessdate = 31 August 2014 | date = 31 August 2014}}</ref> On 20 September, Özil opened the scoring and assisted [[Danny Welbeck]] in a 3–0 victory against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] at [[Villa Park]]. Özil featured in the three following games and started in Arsenal's [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League group stage|Champions League group stage]] victory against [[Galatasaray S.K. (football)|Galatasaray]], providing an assist for Alexis Sánchez in a 4–1 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29362640| title=Özil assists for Arsenal in 4–1 win|publisher=BBC Sport| accessdate = 1 October 2014 | date = 1 October 2014}}</ref> On 8 October, the [[Deutscher Fußball-Bund|DFB]] declared that Özil would be sidelined for between 10 and 12 weeks with a left knee injury obtained during a 2–0 defeat at Chelsea three days prior to the international break. The prognosis would rule him out of the remainder of Arsenal's Champions League group matches, as well as four international fixtures.<ref>{{cite news|title=Mesut Özil: Arsenal midfielder out with knee injury for up to 12 weeks|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29537980|accessdate=9 October 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 October 2014}}</ref>
On 11 January 2015, Özil made his first appearance in three months as a 73rd-minute substitute in a 3–0 win against Stoke City.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jan/11/arsenal-stoke-city-premier-league-match-report|title=Arsenal's Alexis Sánchez dazzles again with double in win over Stoke |date=12 January 2015|accessdate=26 January 2015|work=The Guardian}}</ref> He scored on his return to the starting line-up in Arsenal's 3–2 win at [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] in the fourth round of the [[2014–15 FA Cup|FA Cup]] on 25 January, latching onto a pass from [[Tomáš Rosický]] before scoring Arsenal's second goal.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jan/25/brighton-arsenal-fa-cup-match-report|title=Arsenal through after Brighton scare as Theo Walcott and Mesut Özil return |accessdate=26 January 2015|work=The Guardian}}</ref> In his first Premier League start of the year, Özil scored once and provided an assist for Olivier Giroud as Arsenal beat Aston Villa 5–0 at home on 1 February.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30971833|title=Arsenal 5–0 Aston Villa|date=1 February 2015|publisher=BBC | accessdate = 8 February 2015 | first = Phil | last = Dawkes}}</ref> The following week, Özil scored the opening goal in the Gunners' 2–1 [[North London derby]] defeat to Tottenham at [[White Hart Lane]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31071175|title=Tottenham 2–1 Arsenal|date=7 February 2015|publisher=BBC | accessdate = 8 February 2015 | first = Phil | last = Dawkes}}</ref> He continued his good form by creating both goals in a 2–1 victory over Leicester City on 10 February.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31106369|title=Arsenal 2–1 Leicester|date=10 February 2015|publisher=BBC | accessdate = 10 February 2015 | first = Phil | last = Dawkes}}</ref> He also grabbed a pair of assists two weeks later, in a 2–0 victory against Everton.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31572602|title=Arsenal 2–0 Everton|date=1 March 2015|publisher=BBC | accessdate = 1 March 2015 | first = Phil | last = Dawkes}}</ref> On 4 April, he scored the second goal for his team in a 4–1 win over Liverpool, which would be his final goal of the season.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Arsenal 4–1 Liverpool|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32097847|accessdate=4 April 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 April 2015}}</ref> After a 3–1 win over Hull, manager Arsène Wenger praised him by saying, "Overall his influence was very strong."<ref>{{cite web|last1=Rob|first1=Kelly|title=Wenger – Ozil's influence was so strong|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20150505/wenger-ozil-s-influence-was-so-strong|accessdate=4 April 2015|publisher=Arsenal F.C.|date=5 May 2015}}</ref>
Özil followed up this goal with two assists for [[Alexis Sánchez]] in a 2–1 win against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] in the [[2014–15 FA Cup]] semi-final on 18 April.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/32261616|title=Holders Arsenal reached a record 19th FA Cup final after two goals from Alexis Sanchez sealed victory over Reading in extra-time.|date=18 April 2015|publisher=BBC | accessdate = 11 February 2016 | first = Nabil | last = Hassan}}</ref> Özil started in the [[2015 FA Cup Final]] as Arsenal beat Aston Villa in a commanding 4–0 victory on 30 May, concluding his second season at Arsenal with 5 goals and 9 assists, in 33 appearances across all competitions, and back-to-back FA Cups.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/32856754|title=Arsenal became the most successful club in FA Cup history as they outclassed Aston Villa at Wembley to earn Arsene Wenger a record-equalling sixth triumph.|date=30 May 2015|publisher=BBC | accessdate = 11 February 2016 | first = Phil | last = McNulty}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.us/player/84775/mesut-ozil?season=2014|title=Mesut Özil complete stats for 2014/15 season|date=30 May 2015|accessdate=11 February 2016|work=''espnfc.com''}}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== [[File:Mesut Özil 2015.jpg|thumb|right|Özil playing for Arsenal in 2015]] After scoring during a pre-season game against [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]], Özil received praise from his manager, with Wenger calling for him to have his best season yet in Arsenal colours.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/premier-league-arsene-wenger-backs-mesut-ozil-shine-182631092--sow.html|title=Premier League – Arsene Wenger backs Mesut Ozil to shine|date=25 July 2015|work=Yahoo Eurosport UK|accessdate=27 July 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20160717060517/https://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/premier-league-arsene-wenger-backs-mesut-ozil-shine-182631092--sow.html|archivedate=17 July 2016}}</ref> On 2 August 2015, Özil started for Arsenal in the [[2015 FA Community Shield]], where the Gunners beat league champions Chelsea 1–0 at Wembley Stadium. A week later, he made his first appearance of the [[2015–16 Premier League|Premier League]] season in Arsenal's 2–0 opening day defeat to [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/aug/09/arsenal-west-ham-premier-league-match-report|title=West Ham capitalise on Petr Cech's debut errors to stun nervy Arsenal|date=10 August 2015|work=The Guardian | first = David | last = Hynter | access-date = 21 October 2015}}</ref>
Özil scored his first goal of the [[2015–16 in English football|2015–16 season]] in a 3–0 home victory over Manchester United on 4 October. He had earlier assisted Alexis Sánchez to give the Gunners the lead in the sixth minute of the match.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34372498|title=Arsenal 3–0 Man Utd|publisher=BBC|accessdate=5 October 2015}}</ref> Özil was named man of the match in a 3–0 win at [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]'s [[Vicarage Road]] on 17 October, supplying assists for Sánchez and Olivier Giroud.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/live/football/34214347|title=Premier League: FT Watford 0–3 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=19 October 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34493696|title=Watford 0–3 Arsenal|author=Saj Chowdhury|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=19 October 2015}}</ref> On 20 October, Özil scored his first [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] goal of the season in Arsenal's 2–0 group stage home win over Bayern Munich.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2015/oct/21/arsenal-bayern-munich-champions-league-mesut-ozil|title=Mesut Özil greases the cogs as Arsenal twist and turn to put Bayern in a spin|date=21 October 2015|work=The Guardian | first=Barney | last=Ronay | access-date=21 October 2015}}</ref>
He set a new Premier League record being the first player to assist in six consecutive matches when setting up [[Kieran Gibbs]]' for 1–1 in the derby versus Tottenham on 8 November 2015.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Orr|first1=James|title=Mesut Ozil: Arsenal playmaker makes history in Tottenham draw by becoming first player to assist in six consecutive Premier League games|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/mesut-ozil-arsenal-playmaker-makes-history-in-tottenham-draw-by-becoming-first-player-to-assist-in-a6726421.html|accessdate=8 November 2015|work=The Independent|date=8 November 2015}}</ref> He then extended that run to seven straight games with an assist against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]], before scoring his second Champions League goal of the season in a three-goal victory at home to [[GNK Dinamo Zagreb|Dinamo Zagreb]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34892626|title=Arsenal 3–0 Dinamo Zagreb|author=Phil McNulty|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=30 November 2015}}</ref> He then scored for the second game in a row when he clipped in the opener in a 1–1 draw at Norwich.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34893429|title=Norwich City 1–1 Arsenal|author=James Gheerbrant|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=30 November 2015}}</ref> Özil continued his run of good form by providing four assists in the next three games, against Aston Villa, Manchester City and Sunderland, helping his team win all three matches. On 28 December 2015, Özil assisted the first goal and scored the second in a 2–0 win against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]], creating nine scoring chances in total – the most in a single Premier League game by any player during the season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35148189|title=Arsenal 2–0 Bournemouth |work=BBC Sport |date=28 December 2015 |accessdate=8 January 2016 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Wright|first1=Nick|title=Mesut Ozil in a league of his own as Arsenal beat Bournemouth|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/15118/10113153/mesut-ozil-in-a-league-of-his-own-as-arsenal-beat-bournemouth|accessdate=29 December 2015|publisher=Sky Sports|date=28 December 2015}}</ref>
On 24 January 2016, Özil played his 100th game for the Gunners in a 1–0 home defeat against Chelsea in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.turkish-football.com/mesut-ozil-loses-100th-game-for-arsenal-against-chelsea/|title=Mesut Ozil loses 100th game for Arsenal against Chelsea |author=Emre Sarigul |publisher=Turkish Football |date=25 January 2016 |accessdate=25 January 2016 }}</ref> The next Premier League game against Southampton at home on 2 February saw Özil creating 10 chances – beating the previous record, 9 created and held by him during the season.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://metro.co.uk/2016/02/03/stats-show-arsenal-need-new-striker-after-0-0-draw-despite-mesut-ozil-creating-record-amount-of-chances-5659784/|title=Stats show Arsenal need new striker after 0–0 draw despite Mesut Ozil creating record amount of chances |author=Alex Brodie |publisher=Metro |date=3 February 2016 |accessdate=11 February 2016 }}</ref> This proved in vain, however, as the match ended 0–0 with the Gunners slumping into fourth as they failed to score in three consecutive Premier League games.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/arsenal/12137263/Arsenal-0-Southampton-0-Five-things-we-learned.html|title=Arsenal 0 Southampton 0: Five things we learned |author=Callum Davis |work=The Telegraph |date=2 February 2016 |accessdate=11 February 2016 }}</ref> He then ended the Gunners' barren goal-scoring run in the Premier League with the opener against AFC Bournemouth in a 2–0 away win on 7 February.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35453143|title=Arsenal scored twice in 88 first-half seconds to overwhelm Bournemouth and move level on points with second-placed Tottenham |author=Marc Higginson |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 February 2016 |accessdate=11 February 2016 }}</ref> Özil delivered his 17th assist in the Premier League from a free kick for Danny Welbeck to head in the winner deep into stoppage time as Arsenal came from behind to beat league leaders [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] 2–1 on 14 February.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/feb/14/arsenal-leicester-city-premier-league-match-report|title=Danny Welbeck's last-gasp effort gives Arsenal win over 10-man Leicester |author=Barney Ronay |work=The Guardian |date=14 February 2016 |accessdate=14 February 2016 }}</ref>
After a 2–0 home defeat to Barcelona in the Champions League, Özil scored and assisted in a 3–2 defeat at [[Old Trafford]] to Manchester United as the Gunners lost further ground in the title race.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/feb/28/manchester-united-arsenal-premier-league-match-report|title=Marcus Rashford's double for Manchester United deflates Arsenal hopes |author=Jamie Jackson |work=The Guardian |date=28 February 2016 |accessdate=28 February 2016 }}</ref> Özil started in the 2–1 Watford in the FA Cup, where he set up Danny Welbeck for Arsenal's consolation goal with a backheel assist, and three days later in a 3–1 defeat to Barcelona in the Champions League as Arsenal crashed out in successive cup competitions in March.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/mar/16/barcelona-arsenal-champions-league-match-report|title=Luis Suárez acrobatics end Arsenal's unlikely resistance at Barcelona |author=Sid Lowe |work=The Guardian |date=16 March 2016 |accessdate=19 March 2016 }}</ref>
Özil assisted [[Olivier Giroud]]'s second goal in Arsenal's last Premier League match of the season against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in a 4–0 home victory as the Gunners finished second ahead of fierce rivals, [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]. That was Özil's 19th assist of the season in the league, a record only beaten by [[Thierry Henry]] with 20 in [[2002–03 Arsenal F.C. season|2002–03]] in Premier League history.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/05/15/arsenal-4-aston-villa-0-hosts-clinch-unlikely-st-totteringham-da/|title=Arsenal 4 Aston Villa 0: Hosts clinch unlikely St Totteringham's Day as Olivier Giroud grabs hat-trick |author=Jeremy Wilson |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=15 May 2016 |accessdate=15 May 2016 }}</ref> Özil ended his third season at Arsenal with 8 goals and 20 assists in all club competitions, which won him the Arsenal Player of the Season award.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.com/player/84775/mesut-ozil?season=2015|title=Mesut Özil complete stats for 2015/16 season|date=15 May 2016|accessdate=15 May 2016|work=''espnfc.com''}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.us/arsenal/story/2876662/mesut-ozil-named-arsenals-player-of-the-season-by-fans|title=Mesut Özil complete stats for 2015/16 season|date=20 May 2016|accessdate=11 June 2016|work=''espnfc.com''}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== Özil missed Arsenal's opening day defeat to Liverpool, after his excursions at [[UEFA Euro 2016]] meant he was not match-fit. However, he started his first game of the new [[2016–17 Arsenal F.C. season|season]] for his club in a 1–3 away win at Watford on 28 August, in which he scored his first goal of the campaign, heading in an Alexis Sánchez cross to score Arsenal's third of the afternoon.<ref>{{cite news|title=Watford 1–3 Arsenal – BBC Sport|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37139688|accessdate=27 August 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 August 2016}}</ref> His second arrived just under a month later, netting a controlled volley in a 3–0 home win against Chelsea.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37393486|title=Arsenal 3–0 Chelsea|accessdate=24 September 2016|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 15 October, Özil again scored a volley at home, as he recorded the decider in a tense 3–2 win against Swansea.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37594169|title=Arsenal 3–2 Swansea|accessdate=15 October 2016|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Four days later, in a [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] home game against [[PFC Ludogorets Razgrad|Ludogorets Razgrad]], Özil assisted [[Theo Walcott]]'s goal, and scored his first professional career hat-trick, which was concluded after again volleying as Arsenal went on to win 6–0.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 6–0 Ludogorets|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/arsenal-vs-ludogorets/366885|accessdate=19 October 2016|work=Sky Sports|date=19 October 2016}}</ref> On 29 October, he registered his first league assist of the season, after Giroud latched onto a corner to score the club's third in a 1–4 win against Sunderland.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37737719|title=Sunderland 1–4 Arsenal|accessdate=29 October 2016|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> For his performances, he was awarded the club's Player of the Month award for the month of October.
Özil began November by recording his third assist, which came in the North London derby, and was given after his free kick was turned into the net by opposing defender [[Kevin Wimmer]].<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37814331|title=Arsenal 1–1 Tottenham|accessdate=29 October 2016|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Özil would then record Arsenal's Goal of the Season on 19 October, as he scored a remarkable solo winner in a nervy 2–3 away win against Ludogorets, which capped a resilient comeback after Arsenal were down by two goals in the opening 15 minutes.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 2–3 Ludogorets|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37823801|accessdate=19 October 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Özil stunner vs. Ludogorets|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tl5gxcZRf8s|accessdate=19 October 2016|via=YouTube|date=19 October 2016}}</ref> He scored the opener in a 1–5 away win against West Ham United on 3 December, and assisted the fourth goal. He repeated his set-up exploits three days later in a Champions League win against Basel, feeding Iwobi from the left for the fourth.<ref>{{cite news|title=Basel 1–4 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38212188|accessdate=6 December 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=6 December 2016}}</ref> He then scored a header in a win against Stoke City a week later, before rounding out the year, Özil assisted the only goal in a home victory against West Brom on 26 December.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 1–0 West Brom|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38361074|accessdate=26 December 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 December 2016}}</ref> He registered his first assist of 2017 after placing his corner directly in the path of teammate Mustafi, who headed past [[Tom Heaton]] in a 2–1 win against Burnley.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 2–1 Burnley|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38626832|accessdate=22 January 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 January 2017}}</ref> Despite an impressive first-half to the campaign, Özil would then struggle with muscular problems, and was absent for a number of Arsenal's games.
He returned to fitness to star in a 2–2 draw against Manchester City on 2 April, where he assisted the equalizer.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 2–2 Man City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39396482|accessdate=2 April 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 April 2017}}</ref> He would also break his breaking a four-month cold goalless spell after placing a controlled finish in a 3–0 win against West Ham United three days later, while he also assisted the second.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 3–0 West Ham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39426761|accessdate=5 April 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=5 April 2017}}</ref> He then scored another volley just under two weeks later, in a win against Middlesbrough.<ref>{{cite news|title=Middlesbrough 1–2 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39550227|accessdate=17 April 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 April 2017}}</ref> He then recorded his ninth assist on 10 May, where he set up Sánchez's opener.<ref>{{cite news|title=Southampton 0–2 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39012178|accessdate=10 May 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=10 May 2017}}</ref> In the last three league gameweeks, he scored his final goal of the season against Stoke City,<ref>{{cite news|title=Stoke City 1–4 Arsneal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39827551|accessdate=13 May 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 May 2017}}</ref> while his final two assists arrived in the following two weeks, against both Sunderland and Everton.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 2–0 Sunderland|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39853089|accessdate=16 May 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 3–1 Everton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39912025|accessdate=21 May 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 May 2017}}</ref> Despite the club missing out on the league and Champions League qualification, Özil concluded his fourth season at the club with 12 goals and 13 assists in 44 appearances across all competitions, and featured heavily as he won the [[2017 FA Cup Final|2017 FA Cup]].
====2017–18 season==== [[File:Özil Arsenal.jpg|thumb|right|Özil playing for Arsenal in the [[UEFA Europa League]] in 2018]] Özil entered the 2017–18 season in the final year of his contract, and struggled initially, featuring sparsely with knee inflammation. He recorded a goal and an assist in a 5–2 victory over Everton on 22 October, and recorded another assist a week later, against Swansea City.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41625741|title=Everton 2–5 Arsenal|accessdate=22 October 2017}}</ref><ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41703866|title=Arsenal 2–1 Swansea|accessdate=26 October 2017}}</ref> His performance in the North London Derby on 18 November was heavily praised, after creating the first goal.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41951916 |title=Arsenal 2–0 Sours|accessdate=18 November 2017}}</ref> He then scored and assisted twice in a 5–0 victory over Huddersfield to close out November, and scored in back-to-back weeks to close out December, first in a victory against West Ham, and then a scintillating scooped finish in a 3–3 draw against Liverpool.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42075942|title=Arsenal 5–0 Huddersfield|accessdate=29 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42362392|title=Arsenal 3–3 Liverpool|accessdate=22 December 2017}}</ref>
After entering January with six months remaining on his contract, which would allow him to engage in pre-contract negotiations with any club, Özil assisted in a win over Crystal Palace, and also assisted in a loss in the reverse fixture against Swansea City on 30 January.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42672226|title=Arsenal 4–1 Crystal Palace|accessdate=20 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42784104|title=Swansea 3–1 Arsenal|accessdate=30 January 2018}}</ref> A day later, he re-signed with the club on a three-year extension, keeping him contracted until 2021.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42885533|title=Mesut Ozil: Arsenal midfielder signs new contract until 2021|date=31 January 2018|accessdate=31 January 2018|publisher=BBC}}</ref> It was also reported his salary more than doubled to £350,000 per week, making him the highest-paid player in Arsenal's history.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.espn.co.uk/football/arsenal/story/3369152/arsene-wenger-paying-mesut-ozil-mega-salary-was-cheapest-option-for-arsenal | title = Wenger: Paying Ozil mega salary was 'cheapest option' for Arsenal | publisher = ESPN | date = 2 February 2018 | access-date = 5 February 2018 | first = Mattias | last = Karen}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/01/31/mesut-ozil-signs-new-350000-a-week-deal-become-arsenals-highest/ | title = Mesut Ozil agrees new £350,000-a-week deal to become Arsenal's highest paid player | website = The Telegraph | date = 31 January 2018 | access-date = 5 February 2018 | first = Jeremy | last = Wilson}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42885533 | title = Mesut Ozil: Arsenal midfielder signs new contract until 2021 | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 31 January 2018 | access-date = 5 February 2018 | first = David | last = Ornstein}}</ref>
On 2 February, Özil scored in the first knockout round of the Europa League, netting calmly against [[Östersunds FK|Östersund]].<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pUfGHgPNB3w|title=Östersund 0–3 Arsenal|accessdate=2 February 2018}}</ref> He would then gain a brace of assists in the next round, against [[A.C. Milan|Milan]].<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IIMM04aOarU|title=Arsenal 2–0 Milan|accessdate=2 February 2018}}</ref> On 11 March, he recorded his 50th Premier League assist in a 3–0 win over [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]. In doing so, he became the fastest player to reach 50 assists in the competition, in his 141st appearance, breaking the record previously held by [[Eric Cantona]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11670/11286094/mesut-ozil-brings-up-50-premier-league-assists-in-record-time|title=Mesut Ozil brings up 50 Premier League assists in record time|publisher=Sky Sports|last=Wright|first=Nick|date=12 March 2018|accessdate=12 March 2018}}</ref> He continued his exploits in the Europa League by recording a hat-trick of assists in a victory against [[CSKA Moscow]] on 5 April.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q-NYwUvw-bA|title=Arsenal 4–1 CSKA|accessdate=5 April 2018}}</ref> Persistent injuries limited his involvement in the club's final games of the season, however, Özil ended his fifth season at Arsenal with 5 goals and 13 assists in 35 appearances, and featured heavily in the club's later run and appearance in the [[2018 EFL Cup Final]].
====2018–19 season==== Following the departure of [[Jack Wilshere]], Özil returned to wearing the number 10, for the new season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://metro.co.uk/2018/07/24/mesut-ozil-proudly-shows-off-no-10-shorts-arsenal-team-mate-alexandre-lacazette-7755433/|title=Mesut Ozil proudly shows off his No. 10 shorts to Arsenal team-mate Alexandre Lacazette|date=24 July 2018|accessdate=11 August 2018|publisher=Metro}}</ref> He was also named one of Arsenal's vice-captains.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11670/11469681/laurent-koscielny-named-arsenals-main-captain-by-head-coach-unai-emery|title=Emery names Koscielny main captain|accessdate=11 August 2018}}</ref> Özil scored his first goal of the season in Arsenal's 2–1 away win over Newcastle.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45456658 | title = Newcastle United 1-2 Arsenal: Granit Xhaka's free-kick sets Gunners on way to win | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 15 September 2018 | access-date = 18 September 2018 | first = Harry | last = Poole}}</ref> On 22 October he captained Arsenal for the first time in a 3–1 comeback win over [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]]. He was involved in all three goals, scoring the first, and adding two assists in a man-of-the-match performance.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/arsenal/story/3676113/unai-emery-backs-mesut-ozil-and-arsenal-to-continue-on-with-sexy-football-every-day|title=Emery backs Ozil, Arsenal to continue 'sexy football'|publisher=ESPN|access-date=22 October 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[Image:Mesut Özil.jpg|thumb|upright|Özil playing for [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in 2009]] Eligible to play for either Germany or Turkey, Özil chose to play for his country of birth.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fourfourtwo.com/interviews/qanda/279/article.aspx|title=Ozil – Q&A – Interviews|date=June 2010| work=[[FourFourTwo]]|accessdate=22 April 2012}}</ref> In September 2006, he was called up for the [[Germany national youth football team|Germany under-17 team]]. He was a member of the [[Germany national under-21 football team|German under-21 team]] from 2007. On 29 June 2009, Özil was selected the man of the match in a 4–0 win over [[England national under-21 football team|England]] during the [[2009 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|U-21 European Championship]] final.<ref name="Mesut Özil Bio"/>
He made his debut for the [[Germany national football team|senior side]] during a friendly match against [[Norway national football team|Norway]] on 11 February 2009. He scored his first goal for the senior team in his third appearance, another friendly, against [[South Africa national football team|South Africa]] on 5 September in [[Leverkusen]] at the [[BayArena]].
===2010 FIFA World Cup=== Özil was selected for [[2010 FIFA World Cup squads#Germany|Germany's squad]] for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] in South Africa, starting in all of the team's matches. He provided an assist for [[Cacau]]'s goal to the 4–0 final score against [[Australia national soccer team|Australia]] in Germany's first group game. He scored a left-footed half-volley from the edge of the [[penalty area]] against [[Ghana national football team|Ghana]] in the final group game, ensuring Germany progressed to the second round as [[2010 FIFA World Cup Group D|group]] winners.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2010/matches/match_39/default.stm|title=Ghana 0–1 Germany|date=23 June 2010|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=30 June 2010|first=Jonathan|last=Stevenson}}</ref>
On 27 June 2010, Özil played in Germany's win over [[England national football team|England]] in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup knockout stage|last 16]] match, setting up the fourth goal with a cross to [[Thomas Müller]] as Germany triumphed 4–1.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/world_cup_2010/matches/match_51|title=Germany 4–1 England|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 June 2010|accessdate=27 June 2010|first=Phil|last=McNulty}}</ref> During the quarter-final match against [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]], he assisted the second goal for [[Miroslav Klose]] with a cross to ensure the 4–0 final score for the Germans. [[FIFA]] announced that he was among the ten tournament players nominated for the [[Golden Ball (FIFA)|Golden Ball]].
===UEFA Euro 2012=== [[File:Jerome Boateng 2011 Germany.jpg|thumb|210px|right|Özil lining up for Germany with [[Mario Götze]] (left) and [[Jérôme Boateng]] (in the middle) prior to a match in 2011.]] Özil was one of the leading forces in Germany's [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying|qualification]] for [[UEFA Euro 2012]], scoring five times during the campaign as Germany won all ten of its games to top their [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying Group A|group]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro2012/matches/season%3D2012/round%3D15171/match%3D2002111/index.html|title=Germany stroll past Austria to reach EURO 2012|publisher=UEFA|date=2 September 2011|accessdate=4 September 2011}}</ref> Özil also confirmed his reputation as a decisive passer, as he provided seven assists, more than any European international during Euro 2012 qualification.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sportal.de/sportal/generated/article/fussball/2011/10/11/20895300000.html|title=Die Top-Elf der EM-Qualifikation|publisher=Sportal.de|date=6 October 2011|accessdate=19 October 2011|language=German|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111014183933/http://www.sportal.de/sportal/generated/article/fussball/2011/10/11/20895300000.html|archivedate=14 October 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/statistics/index.html|title=Statistics|publisher=UEFA|accessdate=13 May 2012}}</ref> When asked about his country's chances at [[UEFA Euro 2012|Euro 2012]], Özil simply replied, "We have the potential to beat anyone and we have what it takes to win the title."<ref name="autogeneratedcc">{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/1028494/ozil-to-receive-german-poty-award?cc=5901|title=Ozil to receive German POTY award|publisher=ESPN FC|date=28 February 2012|accessdate=22 April 2012}}</ref>
On 29 February 2012, Özil was recognised as Germany's best international of the year for 2011 prior to kick-off at a friendly against [[France national football team|France]] in [[Bremen]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dfb.de/index.php?id=500014&tx_dfbnews_pi1%5BshowUid%5D=30756&tx_dfbnews_pi4%5Bcat%5D=56|title=Fan Club wählt Mesut Özil zum "Nationalspieler des Jahres"|language=German|publisher=[[German Football Association|DFB]]|date=5 January 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090908210728/http://www.dfb.de/index.php?id=500014|archivedate=8 September 2009}}</ref><ref name="Ozil to receive German POTY award">{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/1028494/ozil-to-receive-german-poty-award?cc=5901|title=Ozil to receive German POTY award|publisher=espnsoccernet.com|accessdate=6 March 2012}}</ref> Özil's Germany were drawn with the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]], [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] and [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] into [[UEFA Euro 2012 Group B|Group B]] at Euro 2012, widely touted as the "[[Group of Death]]."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/sports/2011/12/02/netherlands-germany-drawn-in-euro-group-death/|title=Netherlands, Germany drawn in Euro "Group of Death"|publisher=Fox News Channel|date=2 December 2011|accessdate=22 April 2012}}</ref>
Özil registered two assists, created nine chances, and claimed the Man of the Match award in Germany's 4–2 quarter-final win over [[Greece national football team|Greece]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18355075|title=Germany 4–2 Greece|date=22 June 2012|accessdate=19 August 2015|publisher=BBC}}</ref> He then scored Germany's only goal (a penalty) in their 2–1 loss to Italy in the semi-finals.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18355490|title=Germany 1–2 Italy|date=28 June 2012|accessdate=19 August 2015|publisher=BBC}}</ref> His performance at [[UEFA Euro 2012|Euro 2012]] earned him two Carlsberg Man of the Match Awards. He finished the tournament as the joint-highest assist provider (3) and was named in the [[UEFA European Football Championship Teams of the Tournament|UEFA Euro Team of the Tournament]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/man-of-the-match-award/allwinners/index.html |title=Carlsberg Man of the Match Award |publisher=UEFA |date=2 December 2011 |accessdate=28 June 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130116040612/http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season%3D2012/man-of-the-match-award/allwinners/index.html |archivedate=16 January 2013 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
===2014 FIFA World Cup=== [[File:Award ceremony of the World Cup in Brazil 07.jpg|thumb|left|Özil holding the [[FIFA World Cup Trophy]] after the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final|2014 Final]]]]
Özil ended the [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification]] campaign as Germany's [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)#Goalscorers|top scorer]] with eight goals.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/europe/statistics/topscorers.html |title=Top scorers |accessdate=16 October 2014 |publisher=FIFA |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100919025443/http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/europe/statistics/topscorers.html |archivedate=19 September 2010 |df= }}</ref>
Following an injury to [[Marco Reus]] in a warm-up game, Özil was moved from his customary number 10 role into the left-winger position for the majority of the tournament. He started all seven of Germany's [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] games, and helped Germany make history by becoming the first European team to win the World Cup in South America. Özil scored the decisive goal in the 119th minute of Germany's 2–1 [[2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Round of 16|round of 16]] victory over [[Algeria national football team|Algeria]], a match widely praised as one of the most entertaining of the tournament.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27969924|title=Germany 2–1 Algeria|date=30 June 2014|accessdate=1 July 2014|publisher=BBC}}</ref> Özil then provided an assist for [[Sami Khedira]] in Germany's [[Brazil v Germany (2014 FIFA World Cup)|7–1 semi-final win over Brazil]]. The goal Özil assisted, with a clever pass, made the score 5–0 to Germany after just 29 minutes. The shocking nature of the 5-goal flurry generated worldwide astonishment.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28102403|title=Brazil 1–7 Germany|date=8 July 2014|accessdate=8 July 2014|publisher=BBC}}</ref>
In the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final|final]], Özil played 120 minutes before being replaced by Arsenal teammate [[Per Mertesacker]]. Germany were crowned World Champions with a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28181689|title= Germany 1–0 Argentina |date=14 July 2014|publisher= BBC Sport|accessdate=14 July 2014}}</ref> After the trophy was presented to the Germany team, [[UEFA]] President [[Michel Platini]] asked Özil for his match shirt as a souvenir, and Özil obliged.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.101greatgoals.com/blog/michel-platini-asked-mesut-ozil-for-his-shirt-during-germanys-world-cup-celebrations-picture/|title= Michel Platini asked Mesut Ozil for his shirt during World Cup celebrations |date=14 July 2014|work= 101 Great Goals|accessdate=13 August 2015}}</ref> He concluded the tournament as the leader in passes completed in the final-third (171), was ranked joint-second in chances created (17), behind only [[Lionel Messi]] (23), and ranked second overall in possessions won in the final-third (6).<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2014/07/14/stats-things-mesut-ozil-did-better-than-anybody-else-at-world-cu/|title= Things Mesut Ozil did better than anybody else at World Cup |date=14 July 2014|work= HITC Sport|accessdate=13 August 2015}}</ref>
===UEFA Euro 2016=== On 12 June 2016, Özil completed the full 90 minutes of Germany's opening [[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016]] match against [[Ukraine national football team|Ukraine]] which Germany won 2–0. He assisted [[Bastian Schweinsteiger]]'s goal in the 92nd minute.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36454267 | title = Germany 2–0 Ukraine | publisher = BBC Sport | first = Alistair | last = Magowan | date = 12 June 2016 | access-date = 23 June 2016}}</ref> On 21 June 2016, Özil completed 99% of his passes, created six chances and claimed the Man of the Match award in Germany's win over Northern Ireland.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.squawka.com/news/mesut-ozil-completes-99-of-his-passes-in-dominant-display-against-northern-ireland/704308 | title = Özil MOTM |date=21 June 2016|accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref> Five days later, Özil started in Germany's 3–0 round of 16 win over [[Slovakia national football team|Slovakia]]. In the 13th minute of the match, he had a penalty effort saved by goalkeeper [[Matúš Kozáčik]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Davie|first=Chris (26 June 2016)|url =http://www.goal.com/euro2016/en/article/ozil-sets-unwanted-penalty-record-after-germany-penalty-miss/2bl6kgcks2v81g6iqwgk51d9u | title = Mesut Özil sets unwanted record after Germany penalty miss |website=Goal|accessdate=26 June 2016}}</ref> On 2 July 2016, Özil scored the leading goal against [[Italy national football team|Italy]] in the quarter-finals to give Germany a 1–0 advantage, before Italy later equalised through [[Leonardo Bonucci]]'s penalty.<ref>{{cite news |first1=Brian |last1=Homewood |first2=Ken |last2=Ferris |title=Germany win epic shootout to end Italy jinx |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-soccer-euro-ger-ita-idUKKCN0ZI0ZA |agency=[[Reuters]] |date=3 July 2016 |accessdate=3 July 2016}}</ref> Germany, however, emerged as the victorious side after winning the penalty shoot-out 6–5, despite Özil failing to convert his penalty kick after hitting the goal post.<ref>{{cite news |title=Germany seal dramatic penalty shoot-out win over Italy |url=https://www.rte.ie/sport/euro-2016/2016/0702/799727-germany-italy/ |website=[[RTÉ Sport]] |publisher=[[Raidió Teilifís Éireann]] |date=2 July 2016 |accessdate=3 July 2016}}</ref>
