===2018 FIFA World Cup=== Özil was selected by manager Joachim Löw in Germany's final 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dw.com/en/germany-announce-final-world-cup-squad-with-manuel-neuer-without-leroy-san%C3%A9/a-44064011|title=Germany announce final World Cup squad, with Manuel Neuer, without Leroy Sané|publisher=Deutsche Welle|accessdate=4 June 2018}}</ref> Despite the national team heavily under-performing as defending champions by being eliminated in the group stages, Özil featured in two of the country's three games, and averaged more chances per 90 minutes (5.5) than any other player in the competition.<ref>{{cite tweet| user=Squawka| number=1021023103332298753| title=Mesut Özil created more chances per 90 minutes (5.5) at the 2018 World Cup than any other player to play at least 90 minutes at the tournament. 11 created in total in 180 minutes of football.|date=22 July 2018| author=Squawka Football}}</ref>
===Retirement controversy=== In May 2018, Özil, alongside fellow German international [[İlkay Gündoğan]], both of Turkish descent, met with and posed for photographs with Turkish president [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]], in the lead up to the [[2018 Turkish general election|Turkish general election]]. The photograph was interpreted as a form of political support for Erdoğan and his policies, and caused tensions in Germany.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-44122247 | title = Özil and Gundogan's Erdogan photos cause German furore | publisher = BBC | date = 15 May 2018 | access-date = 6 August 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/av/world-europe-39174164/turkey-s-president-erdogan-s-nazi-germany-taunt|title=Erdogan taunts Germany with Nazi comparison| publisher = BBC |access-date = 23 July 2018 | date = 22 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.dw.com/en/germany-blocks-erdogan-rally-around-hamburg-g20/a-39467166|title=Germany block Erdogan rally in Hamburg| website = DW|access-date = 23 July 2018 | date = 22 July 2018}}</ref> The [[German Football Association]] (DFB) distanced themselves from public criticism,<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/may/16/mesut-ozil-ilkay-gundogan-recep-tayyip-erdogan-picture | title = Özil and Gündoğan's Erdoğan picture causes anger in Germany | website = The Guardian | date = 16 May 2018 | access-date = 6 August 2018 | first = Philip | last = Oltermann}}</ref> opting to end the debate,<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.abendblatt.de/sport/article214522769/Wuetender-Bierhoff-kanzelt-ARD-Moderator-Bommes-wegen-Erdogan-Frage-ab.html | title = Bierhoff fährt Bommes wegen Özil und Gündogan an | language = de | website = Hamburger Abendblatt | date = 8 June 2018 | access-date = 6 August 2018}}</ref> and focus on the upcoming World Cup campaign, in which both Özil and Gündoğan participated.
After the nation's World Cup campaign, losing out at the group stage, Özil posted a series of messages on [[social media]] on 22 July, in order to clarify the photograph and address the criticisms he had faced. In a lengthy post, he described the photograph as simply "respecting the highest office of my family's country", while also adding his conversations with Erdoğan revolved solely around their mutual interest in football.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/nationalelf/728002/artikel_mesut-oezil-tritt-aus-der-nationalmannschaft-zurueck.html|title=Mesut Özil tritt aus der Nationalmannschaft zurück|publisher=kicker.de|language=German|accessdate=22 July 2018}}</ref> Özil also commented on several media outlets that were using the photograph to push right-wing propaganda, while also selectively criticizing him for his Turkish background, noting the lack of media uproar after [[Lothar Matthäus]] met with Russian leader [[Vladimir Putin]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bavarianfootballworks.com/2018/7/22/17599796/ozil-turkish-president-erdogan-german-politics-arsenal-die-mannschaft-germany-national-team-football|title=Özil speaks, defends meeting with Turkish president and calls out DFB for double-standards|publisher=BavarianFootball|accessdate=23 July 2018}}</ref> Matthäus was subsequently criticized for his meeting with Putin.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.sportbuzzer.de/artikel/lothar-matthaus-wladimir-putin-fotos-erklarung/ | title = Doppelmoral-Debatte: Lothar Matthäus erklärt seine Fotos mit Wladimir Putin | language = German | website = Sportbuzzer | date = 8 July 2018 | access-date = 18 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.huffingtonpost.de/entry/matthaus-shitstorm-putin-foto_de_5b4300cee4b05127ccf3b843 | title = Matthäus bekommt Shitstorm nach Putin-Foto – und schlägt zurück | language = German | website = huffingtonpost.de | date = 9 July 2018 | access-date = 18 August 2018}}</ref>
He later detailed his core issue with the national team stemmed from his interactions with [[Reinhard Grindel]], the DFB president, accusing him of displaying both racism and disrespect on multiple occasions, while also noting similar incidents with other high-profile German nationals, namely Bernd Holzhauer and Werner Steer.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jul/22/mesut-ozil-retires-german-national-team-discrimination|title=Mesut Ozil walks away from Germany team citing ‘racism and disrespect’| work= [[The Guardian]] |access-date = 23 July 2018 | date = 22 July 2018| first = Tom | last = Bryant}}</ref> He then retired from the team as a form of protest against members of "racially discriminative backgrounds" who work within the Federation.<ref>{{cite tweet| user=MesutOzil1088| number=1020984884431638528| first = Mesut | last = Özil| title=The past couple of weeks have given me time to reflect, and time to think over the events of the last few months. Consequently, I want to share my thoughts and feelings about what has happened.| date=22 July 2018 | access-date=23 July 2018}}</ref> Following the announcement of his retirement, both the DFB and Özil drew criticism from the public, former players, and managers, however, Özil was also backed by many of his counterparts, including his former national team captain [[Philipp Lahm]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Lahm fordert Ehrlichkeit – und Umdenken nach Özil-Affäre|url=https://www.welt.de/sport/fussball/wm-2018/article179157786/Nationalmannschaft-Lahm-fordert-Ehrlichkeit-und-Umdenken-nach-Oezil-Affaere.html|work=[[Die Welt]]|date=11 July 2018|language=German | access-date = 19 December 2018}}</ref> and former Arsenal and Werder Bremen teammate [[Per Mertesacker]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Mertesacker springt seinem alten Freund Özil zur Seite|url=https://www.nwzonline.de/werder-bremen/hamburg-dfb-team-mertesacker-springt-seinem-alten-freund-oezil-zur-seite_a_50,1,4238196244.html|work=Nordwest-Zeitung |date=12 July 2018|language=German | access-date = 19 December 2018}}</ref>

==Outside football== ===Personal life=== Özil is a third-generation [[Turks in Germany|Turkish-German]],<ref>{{cite web|last=White|first=Duncan|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup-2010/teams/germany/7823376/Germany-v-Australia-Mesut-Ozil-at-head-of-the-vanguard-for-new-generation.html|title=Germany v Australia: Mesut Ozil at head of the vanguard for new generation|work=The Daily Telegraph|date=12 June 2010|accessdate=17 June 2010}}</ref> who, in reference to his game, concludes, "My technique and feeling for the ball is the Turkish side to my game. The discipline, attitude and always-give-your-all is the German part."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sport.scotsman.com/sport/Mesut-zil-National-Treasure.6386348.jp|title=Mesut Özil: National Treasure|work=The Scotsman|date=27 June 2010|accessdate=4 October 2010|last=Smith|first=Andrew}}</ref> He attended [[Gesamtschule Berger Feld]].<ref>{{cite web | url =https://www.deutschlandfunkkultur.de/gesamtschule-berger-feld-in-gelsenkirchen-wo-manuel-neuer.1008.de.html?dram:article_id=421109 | title =Wo Manuel Neuer und Mesut Özil die Schulbank drückten | play for both Turkey and Germany.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.sport1.de/de/fussball/fussball_dfbteam/artikel_44931.html | title = Geht Özil dem DFB von der Fahne? | language = de | website = Sport1 | date = 15 December 2008 | access-date = 18 August 2018}}</ref> At the age of 17 he decided on German citizenship and began playing for Germany U-19 team.<ref name="Real profile English" /> According to Özil's own words and the majority of sources, his ancestors are ethnic Turks<ref name=hurriyetdailynews1>{{cite web|title= German Turks set for face-off on football pitch |url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/default.aspx?pageid=438&n=german-turk-ozil-set-to-play-against-turkey-2010-10-07|website=Hürriyet Daily News | date = 10 July 2010 | accessdate = 22 February = Yasin Madyb | last = Ilgun}}</ref> from [[Devrek]], [[Zonguldak Province|Zonguldak]] in northwestern Turkey.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sabah.com.tr/Spor/2010/06/27/mesut_ozilin_hayali_barca|title=Mesut Özil'in hayali Barça|publisher=Sabah|language=Turkish|date=27 June 2010|accessdate=28 June 2010}}</ref> However, community in Germany}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Uğur |last=Ergan |url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/sporarena/adanasporun-ucuncu-hazirlik-maci-yarin-40911246|title= Mesut Barzani'den Mesut Özil'e davet |trans-title=Invitation to Mesut Özil from Mesut Barzani |work=Hürriyet | language=tr | date=15 July 2010 | accessdate=28 July 2018|quote=The [[Peyamner News Agency]], known for its closeness to the Iraqi [[Kurdistan Democratic Party]], led by [[Masoud Barzani|Barzani]], announced that he invited Mesut Özil to Northern Iraq, stating that his family had [[Diyarbakır]]ish and Kurdish origin.}}</ref>
Özil is a practising Muslim. He recites from the [[Quran]] before his matches. Talking to the [[Berlin]]-based daily ''[[Der Tagesspiegel]]'', Özil said, "I always do that before I go out [on the pitch]. I pray and my teammates know that they cannot talk to me during this brief period."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tagesspiegel.de/sport/fussball-wm2010/ich-habe-nie-angst/1873174.html|title=Mesut Özil: Ich habe nie Angst|first=Michael|last=Rosentritt|date=2 July 2010|work=Der Tagesspiegel|language=German|trans-title=Mesut Özil: I am never afraid|quote=TAGESSPIEGEL: Ihre Art sich direkt vor einem Spiel zu konzentrieren ist es, Verse aus dem Koran leise vor sich hin zu sprechen. MESUT ÖZIL: Das mache ich in der Kabine, bevor wir rausgehen. Ich bete dann und meine Mitspieler wissen schon, dass sie in dieser kurzen Zeit nicht mit mir reden können.}}</ref> He observes fasting during the Islamic month of [[Ramadan]], but he has admitted that: "Because of my job I cannot follow Ramadan properly. I do it only the few days I can, only when I have a free day. But other than that it's impossible, because you have to drink and eat a lot to stay at peak fitness."<ref>{{cite news |last=Singh|first=Amar|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2871/special/2011/08/27/2637353/my-manager-told-me-to-choose-between-fasting-or-playing-i|title='My manager told me to choose between fasting or playing – I chose to fast' – how Muslim footballers including Mesut Ozil and Amr Zaki approach Ramadan|publisher=Goal.com|date=27 August 2011|accessdate=4 January 2013}}</ref> In May 2016, he performed ''[[Umrah]]'' pilgrimage to [[Mecca]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Mesut Ozil visits Muslim holy city Mecca ahead of Euro 2016|url=http://www.squawka.com/news/mesut-ozil-visits-muslim-holy-city-mecca-ahead-of-euro-2016/677656|accessdate=31 May 2016|publisher=Squawka|date=23 May 2016}}</ref> During a [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] match against [[Atletico Madrid]], an Atletico fan threw a piece of bread at Ozil while he was preparing to take a corner. Ozil picked up the bread, kissed it, and brought it to his forehead to express gratitude towards the food given to him, which is important in Islam. His gesture was later widely applauded throughout the stadium.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/6155713/mesut-ozil-takes-bite-out-of-baguette-thrown-at-him-during-atletico-madrid-clash/|title=Mesut Ozil kisses bread thrown at him by Atletico Madrid fans during Europa League clash|work=The Sun|date=27 April 2018|access-date=4 January 2019}}</ref>
In 2010, Özil received the [[Bambi (prize)|Bambi award]] for being a prime example of successful integration within German society.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://in.reuters.com/article/idINIndia-52875620101112|title=Soccer stars steal show at Germany's Bambi Awards|agency=Reuters|date=12 November 2010|accessdate=13 November 2010}}</ref>
Özil started dating singer [[Mandy Capristo]] in 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/336628/Mesut-Ozil-s-popstar-girlfriend-Mandy-Capristo-joins-Arsenal-glamour-WAGs|title=Mesut Ozil's popstar girlfriend Mandy Capristo joins Arsenal glamour WAGs| work= Daily Star|date= 4 September 2013| accessdate = 30 June 2014}}</ref> The relationship ended in October 2014, following reports of Özil being involved with another woman.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.mid-day.com/articles/mandy-capristo-splits-from-mesut-ozil-after-his-affair/15690161 | title=Mandy Capristo splits from Mesut Ozil after his affair | work=Mid-day | date=17 October 2014 | accessdate=6 June 2015}}</ref> On 12 November 2015, Özil and Capristo appeared together at the Bambi awards ceremony in [[Berlin]].<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/arsenal-star-mesut-ozil-pictured-6824875 | title= Arsenal star Mesut Ozil pictured with former girlfriend in Berlin after rumoured split last year | work=Mirror | date=13 November 2015 | accessdate=16 November 2015}}</ref> An [[Instagram]] photo uploaded by Özil used the [[hashtag]] #OziStoIsBack, suggesting that the couple is back together.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.sportsmole.co.uk/off-the-pitch/arsenal/news/mesut-ozil-back-with-ex-girlfriend-mandy_257191.html | title=Arsenal's Mesut Ozil rekindles relationship with ex-girlfriend Mandy Capristo? | work=Sports Mole | date=13 November 2015 | accessdate=16 November 2015}}</ref> However, they broke up in 2017 and Özil has been dating former Miss Turkey, [[Amine Gülşe]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.101greatgoals.com/news/social/mesut-ozil-gets-super-close-to-former-miss-turkey-amine-gulse/|title=Mesut Ozil gets super close to former Miss Turkey, Amine Gulse|date=28 June 2017|accessdate=23 August 2017}}</ref>
===Philanthropy=== As part of the BigShoe project, Özil donated his 2014 World Cup winnings, an estimated £240,000, to pay for 23 sick Brazilian children to have medical surgery as a "personal thank you for the hospitality of the people of [[Brazil]]."<ref>{{cite web|last1=Gill|first1=Kerian|title=Mesut Ozil donates World Cup winnings so 23 children can have surgery in Brazil as 'personal thank you for the hospitality'|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/worldcup2014/article-2695152/Mesut-Ozil-donates-World-Cup-winnings-23-children-surgery-Brazil.html|website=Daily Mail|accessdate=22 July 2014}}</ref>
In May 2016, international media covered Özil's visit to the Zaatari refugee camp in Jordan, home to around 80,000 people displaced as a result of the Syrian civil war. Özil toured the camp as well as playing with children, signing autographs and handing out football shirts.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3597801/Arsenal-s-Mesut-Ozil-heads-Jordan-kick-starstruck-child-refugees.html | title=Arsenal's Mesut Ozil heads out to Jordan for a kick-about with starstruck child refugees | date=19 May 2016 | access-date = 30 June 2016 | first = Spencer | last = Morgan}}</ref>
In 2017, he worked with the charity My Shining Star to make a child cancer patient's dreams come true. He invited the child, Charlie, to be a guest at his private box and in the player's lounge during a game with Sunderland at [[Emirates Stadium]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/85/england/2017/05/09/35365242/charity-thanks-class-ozil-for-making-dream-come-true-for|title=Arsenal news: Charity thanks 'class' Ozil for making dream come true for child with brain tumour |date=9 May 2017|work=''Goal.com''|access-date=10 May 2017}}</ref>
===Media and sponsorships=== In 2013, Özil signed a sponsorship deal with German sportswear and equipment supplier [[Adidas]].<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.footballboots.co.uk/13183-mesut-ozil-adidas-boots.html | title= Mesut Ozil switches to the Three Stripes! | publisher = Footballboots.co.uk | date = 12 July 2013 | accessdate = 1 August 2013}}</ref> He has appeared in commercials for [[Adidas Predator]] boots with other star players such as [[Lionel Messi]], [[Gareth Bale]], [[Thomas Müller]] and [[James Rodriguez]]. One of those adverts, entitled "Create Your Own Game", was released in August 2015, in which Özil featured alongside those players.<ref name="Adverts">{{cite news|title=Lionel Messi, Gareth Bale and Mesut Ozil star in exciting new Adidas advert|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/row-zed/lionel-messi-gareth-bale-mesut-6207334|date=6 August 2015|work=Daily Mirror|accessdate=20 August 2015}}</ref> In 2013, Özil launched his own logo.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.footballboots.co.uk/13820-mesut-ozil-launches-his-own-logo.html | title=Mesut Özil Launches His Own Logo | publisher = Footballboots.co.uk | date = 1 August 2013 | accessdate = 1 August 2013}}</ref>
Özil's "M" [[goal celebration]] – which is in tribute to his young niece Mira – is included in [[EA Sports]]' ''[[FIFA 17]]''.<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United’s Paul Pogba dab, Arsenal's Mesut Ozil dummy and the best Fifa 17 celebrations |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-s-paul-pogba-dab-arsenals-mesut-ozil-dummy-and-the-best-fifa-17-celebrations-a3352696.html |accessdate=11 October 2018 |work=London Evening Standard}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=REVEALED: The heartwarming meaning behind Ozil's 'M' celebration |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1862/premier-league/2016/10/15/28502012/revealed-the-heartwarming-meaning-behind-ozils-m-celebration |accessdate=11 October 2018 |agency=Goal}}</ref> His autobiography, ''The Magic of the Game / Gunning for Greatness'', was released in March 2017.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://metro.co.uk/2017/03/03/revealed-how-mesut-ozil-pleaded-with-arsenal-manager-arsene-wenger-to-end-his-real-madrid-hell-6485256/ | title= Revealed: How Mesut Ozil pleaded with Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger to end his Real Madrid hell | work = Metro|location=UK | date = 3 March 2017 | accessdate = 13 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/arsenal-news-mesut-ozil-jose-mourinho-row-real-madrid-coward-a7607316.html | title= Arsenal's Mesut Özil was called a 'coward' by Jose Mourinho in blistering dressing-room row at Real Madrid | work = The Independent | date = 2 March 2017 | accessdate = 13 March 2017}}</ref>
